messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Kool-Aid
messages.msgSnippet: ... == Our dd (10) did the pink color a little while back. Although it didn t come out as pink as she would ve liked, it was still very pretty :) Todd ...
messages.messageBody:
GDobes@... wrote:

>It's also what many of the kids use to make all the interesting hair colors
>(purple, pink, etc).
>
>Ginny
==
Our dd (10) did the 'pink' color a little while back. Although it didn't
come out as "pink" as she would've liked, it was still very pretty :)

Todd
---------------------------------------------------------------
"Respect the child. Be not too much his parent. Trespass not on his solitude."
-Ralph Waldo Emerson

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Kool-Aid
messages.msgSnippet: ... colors ... From what I ve heard, it only works on very blonde hair.  Otherwise it needs to be bleached first. Tia
messages.messageBody:
>
> It's also what many of the kids use to make all the interesting hair
colors
> (purple, pink, etc).

From what I've heard, it only works on very blonde hair. Otherwise it needs
to be bleached first.
Tia
